en: Before the gun does its dirty work, there is one more thing to report.
zh: 在槍完成它的骯髒使命之前，還有一件事情需要說一說。

en: This isn’t being written down because you think things are going to work out okay, or that Captain A has found a different white whale to chase and doesn’t need this vessel anymore, but because when your family looks back at everything, they can understand what it was like.
zh: 這件事之所以沒有寫下來，是因為你以為事情會順利解決的。或者說，「阿爾茨船長」發現了另一頭白鯨去駕馭，這艘船就可以捨棄了。當你的家人回顧這一切時，他們可以感同身受。

en: Maybe it can help others.
zh: 這也許還可以幫助他人。

en: Hard to call it a silver lining, but maybe researchers in the near future might learn something here that can help them map the streets of Batshit County.
zh: 雖然很難稱之為治愈的一線希望，但也許在不久的將來，研究人員可以在這裏學到有用的東西，這可以幫助他們更加了解瘋人縣裡人們的思想軌跡。

en: You are trying to keep the suicide notes short.
zh: 你想把遺書寫得簡明扼要。

en: One is written and the other is still pending.
zh: 一份已經寫好了，而另一份仍在寫。

en: The written one is full of I’m sorry and I love you.
zh: 寫好的那一份滿篇都是「對不起」還有「我愛你」。

en: The person you need to apologize to the most is Belinda Murray.
zh: 而你最對不起的那個人是貝琳達·穆雷。

en: Sandra came down to the office earlier.
zh: 桑德拉來寫作房的時間比以往要早些。

en: She actually knocked before coming in, which is something she always used to do before opening the door, which always made your job feel so formal for lack of a better word.
zh: 她進來時，甚至還敲了敲門，她每次開門前總是要敲敲門，這總是讓你感覺很「正式」，有時你甚至找不到恰當的字眼來形容這件事。

en: She knocked and she came in and sat on the couch.
zh: 她敲敲門，走了進來，坐在沙發上。

en: You sat in the office chair with the suicide note hidden beneath the pad you’re about to write the second one on. She glanced at the pad then at you.
zh: 你坐在辦公椅上，把那份遺書藏在筆記本下，你要在筆記本上寫下第二份遺書。

en: Have you killed other people?
zh: 「你還殺了其他人嗎？」

en: she asked, and she sounded so resigned to the fact there would be more bad news.
zh: 她問，聲音聽起來像是她已經接受了，並做了接受更壞的消息的準備。

en: But how can you be so sure?
zh: 「你怎麼能這麼肯定？」

en: It was a question you’ve been asking yourself, and you gave her the answer you’d come up with. Because I’d know.
zh: 你也一直在捫心自問，而你只能給她你想到的答案：「因為我就是知道。」

en: So you knew you killed Belinda?
zh: 「那麼，你知道你殺了貝琳達？」

en: Then how can you sit there and say you’ve never hurt anybody?
zh: 「那麼，你怎麼能坐在那裡說你從未傷害過任何人？」

en: You had no answer, and didn’t offer one.
zh: 你也不知道，所以沒有回答。

en: Instead you asked a question of your own. Have you called the police? No, she said.
zh: 相反，你向她提出自己的問題：「你打電話報警了嗎？」

en: So you told her.
zh: 於是你告訴了她。

en: You remembered the speech at the wedding, you remembered coming home and watching it online over and over.
zh: 你記得在婚禮上的講話，記得回家后一遍又一遍地在線觀看視頻。

en: Her face tightened into a scowl when you told her you were drinking.
zh: 當你告訴她你還喝酒時，她皺緊了眉頭，臉陰沉沉的。

en: You told her about sneaking out the window.
zh: 你還告訴她你曾偷偷從窗戶跳了出去，溜走。

en: To go and see Belinda, she said.
zh: 「去看貝琳達。」她說。

en: You shook your head. Just to go for a walk. To stretch my legs. To find a bar somewhere.
zh: 你搖一搖頭：「只是去散散步，伸展一下雙腿，找一間酒吧。」

en: She looked like she didn’t believe that. And then?
zh: 她看上去不相信：「接下來呢？」

en: Tell me about the shirt, she said.
zh: 「說說這件襯衫的事。」她說。

en: Your shirt.
zh: 「什麼？」「你的襯衫。

en: I checked the laundry and it’s not there.
zh: 我找遍了洗衣間，它不在那裡。

en: I can’t find it anywhere.
zh: 我哪兒也找不到它。」

en: She looked at the floor. Is it under there?
zh: 她看著地板，「它在那裡？」

en: You thought about lying, but what was the point?
zh: 你想過撒謊，但究竟說什麼好呢？

en: Yes.
zh: 「是的。」

en: You hid it, she said.
zh: 「你把它藏起來了。」她說。

en: Yes.
zh: 「是的。」

en: Then why not hide the knife?
zh: 「那你為什麼不把刀藏起來呢？」

en: Because— She held her hand up.
zh: 「因為——」她把手攥成拳頭。

en: Because you didn’t know you’d done it.
zh: 因為你不知道是不是你乾的。

en: You found the shirt, but not the knife.
zh: 你找到了襯衫，但沒有找到刀。

en: That’s why I’m not calling the police, she said, because I know you weren’t in control.
zh: 這就是我沒有報警的原因，」她說，「因為我知道你失控了。」

en: She stared at you then, and finally you got it. She wasn’t deciding whether or not to call the police, she never had been. Sandra was giving you another option, an option that, under the circumstances, shows just how much she still loves you.
zh: 桑德拉給了你另一種選擇，那就是即使在這種情況下也要表明她到底有多愛你。

en: It was an option you were already in the process of taking, and perhaps she sensed that.
zh: 你也做出了選擇，也許她也感覺到這一點。

en: You had humiliated her and ruined Eva’s wedding, you murdered a young woman, but Sandra was only thinking of you.
zh: 你羞辱她，毀了伊娃的婚禮，你殺害了一個年輕的女人，但桑德拉總是在為你著想。

en: She was going to allow you to decide what was coming next.
zh: 她打算讓你自己來決定未來。

en: Future Jerry, just know that in that moment you have never loved your wife more.
zh: 未來的傑瑞，你在那一刻才知道，你有多麼愛你的妻子。

en: I just need a little time to figure it out, you said, the words slow and even, their unspoken meaning clear, and you never looked away from her and she never looked away from you.
zh: 「我只是需要時間去想清楚。」你慢慢地、含混不清地說，模稜兩可。你的視線從未離開過她，她的視線也從未離開過你。

en: An hour, you said.
zh: 「一個小時。」你說，「我需要一個小時。」

en: She wasn’t crying, but she was close. Her mouth was shaking a little. You walked over to her, and you felt strong. She put her arms out and you stepped into them and wrapped your own around her and she sobbed into your neck and held you tight, and she felt like she’s always felt, warm and comfortable, and before Captain A ruined your life you would hug Sandra like that all the time.
zh: 你向她走過去，她張開手臂，你擁抱了她，她把臉貼在你的脖子上啜泣，緊緊地擁抱著你，她給你的感覺一如既往的溫馨舒適，在「阿爾茨船長」摧毀了你的生活之前，你會一直這樣擁抱著桑德拉。

en: I love you, you told her.
zh: 「我愛你。」你告訴她說。

en: She couldn’t bring herself to say the words back. She couldn’t say anything.
zh: 她無力說話，什麼也說不出來。

en: Then she was running out of the office and out of the house, leaving you alone.
zh: 她跑出寫作房，跑出家門，只剩下你獨自一人。

en: Completely. And utterly. Alone.
zh: 完全地、徹底地、孤零零地獨自一人。

en: You will never see another person, Future Jerry. Never talk to another person.
zh: 你不會再看到其他人了，未來的傑瑞，你不會再跟其他人說話了。

en: You told Sandra an hour, but that didn’t allow for the Madness Journal entry, but thankfully other things haven’t taken so long. The suicide note was ten minutes.
zh: 你告訴桑德拉說需要一個小時，但寫「狂人日記」不止一個小時，幸運的是，做其他的事情沒用

en: It took fifteen to tape a couple of trash bags to the wall, and there was a tarpaulin in the garage that you’ve ended up laying across the floor.
zh: 那麼久：寫遺書用了十分鐘，用膠帶把垃圾袋粘在牆上用了十五分鐘，最後，你又把車庫裡的防水帆布鋪到地板上。

en: You also have a pillowcase to put over your head to contain the splatter. Since then you’ve been writing and ignoring the phone that keeps ringing, because what could you possibly say to anybody calling?
zh: 你把一個枕套套在頭上以控制飛濺的血液，隨後你奮筆疾書，置響聲大作的電話于不顧，你又能對打電話的人說些什麼呢？

en: It’s time, Future Jerry, to put down the pen and conclude this messy affair.
zh: 未來的傑瑞，現在是時候放下手中的筆，結束這一切了。

en: What will the bloggers say?
zh: 那些博主會說些什麼呢？

en: The ending was predictable, maybe. From Jerry Grey’s first book it was obvious he would blow his brains out in his office.
zh: 結局很明顯，從傑瑞·格雷寫第一本書開始，他就決定在辦公室里用槍打爆自己的腦袋。

en: Still stalling.
zh: 還是拖延。

en: Sandra will be back in ten minutes.
zh: 桑德拉將在十分鐘后回來。

en: The gun is on the desk. It’s heavier than you remember. It’s going to make a hell of a sound, but with the office door closed, nobody is going to hear it.
zh: 槍就放在桌上，它比你記憶中的要重，它會發出可怕的聲音，但是，因為寫作房的門緊緊關閉著，沒有人會聽到。

en: It’s time.
zh: 是時候了。

en: Jerry stays sitting in the car as Hans makes his way inside.
zh: 漢斯向前門走去，傑瑞仍坐在車裡。

en: The front door of the house is adjacent to the garage, so when Hans opens it Jerry can hear the conversation through the wall.
zh: 前門就隔著車庫，所以漢斯打開前門時，傑瑞可以隔著牆聽到談話聲。

en: They introduce themselves as Detectives Jacobson and Mayor.
zh: 他們做了自我介紹，原來是雅各布森和梅厄警官。

en: He’s sure they are the same two men who drove him into the police station.
zh: 他確定是上次押送他到警局的那兩個人。

en: They tell Hans he must know where Jerry Grey is.
zh: 他們對漢斯說，他們必須知道傑瑞·格雷在哪裡。

en: “Because we ran the number he called from the SIM card he purchased, and that led us to you,” one of the men says, and that’s why they’re here so early.
zh: 「你們怎麼覺得我會知道？」漢斯問。「因為我們查詢了從他買的電話卡上撥出的電話，並實施追蹤技術，這樣就追查到了你。」其中一人說，這就是他們這麼早到來的原因。

en: Neither Hans nor himself, nor Henry for that matter, made that connection.
zh: 無論是漢斯還是他自己，還是亨利，都與此事無關。

en: Jerry figures he’s lucky not to be in the back of a patrol car right now.
zh: 傑瑞心裏慶幸自己沒有坐在警車上。

en: Then he figures that may still happen depending on what Hans says.
zh: 然後，他心想接下來會發生什麼還要取決於漢斯怎麼說。

en: “Yeah, he rang me,” Hans says, “and yes I picked him up from the mall.
zh: 「是啊，他是打電話給我了。」漢斯說，「是的，我在商場接到了他。

en: He was confused and lost. I rang his daughter and told her he was safe.
zh: 他神志不清，我打電話給他的女兒，告訴她他很安全。

en: I was going to take him back to the home, but then she gave us some news to make me realize we needed to head to the police station.”
zh: 我要帶他回家，但她給我們透露了一些消息，讓我意識到我們需要到警局去。」

en: Jerry’s heart sinks at the idea of Hans turning him in.
zh: 漢斯把他出賣了，想到這裏，傑瑞心裏一沉。

en: Carefully he opens the door, making no sound.
zh: 他小心翼翼地打開門，盡量不發出一點兒聲音。

en: “So he’s here at the moment then,” one of the detectives says.
zh: 「那麼他現在就在這裏吧？」其中一個警官說。

en: Hans laughs. “Sorry, guys, but you’ve jumped the gun on that one.
zh: 漢斯笑著說：「對不起，夥計們，你們也太操之過急了。

en: When I told him I was going to take him to you, he hit me when we were stuck at the next set of lights and jumped out of the car. He ran across the road and by the time I was able to turn the car around I couldn’t find him.”
zh: 我告訴他我要帶他去見你們，當我們停在一個紅綠燈前時，他打了我，跳下車，跑到馬路對面去了，我把車掉過頭后已經找不到他了。」

en: Paused at the doorway between the garage and the hall, Jerry considers what he’s just heard, then slowly makes his way back into the garage.
zh: 傑瑞在車庫門口停了下來，心裏思忖著他剛剛聽到的話，接著慢慢走回車庫去了。

en: “So you let him go?
zh: 「所以你就讓他走了？

en: “No, it makes me a good friend for not hitting him back.”
zh: 「不，沒有還手打他才是好朋友。」

en: “You knew he was wanted in connection with multiple homicides, and you didn’t feel any civic duty to call us and update us?”
zh: 「你知道嗎，他因多起殺人案被通緝了，你沒有打電話給我們，也沒有告訴我們最新消息，你完全沒有盡到一個公民應盡的義務。」

en: “In other words why didn’t I do your job for you? Is that what you’re asking?”
zh: 「換句話說，你是在問我為什麼沒有為你們工作是嗎？

en: “What my partner is asking is why are you bullshitting us?
zh: 「我的搭檔在問，你為什麼信口雌黃對我們扯謊？

en: We know he’s here.”
zh: 我們知道他現在在這裏。」

en: Hans laughs again. “You guys have more of an imagination than Jerry, and if he was here, and you believed it, then it wouldn’t be you here, but an armed unit busting down my door.”
zh: 漢斯又笑了笑，說：「你們這些人的想象力要比傑瑞豐富得多，如果他在這裏，那麼在這裏的就不該是你們，而是武裝罪犯調查組的人，他們會踏破我家的門。」

en: “So you won’t mind if we come in and take a look around?”
zh: 「那麼，我們要是進來到處看看你不會介意吧？」

en: “Of course I mind.
zh: 「我當然介意了。

en: My parents always told me not to talk to strangers, and that’s what you guys are, right?
zh: 我的父母總是告訴我不要和陌生人說話，說的就是你們這些人，明白嗎？

en: Plus my lawyer would be against it. He would want you to have a warrant because that’s the way he thinks.
zh: 而且我的律師會反對，他會讓你們出示搜查令，因為這就是他的思維方式。

en: I tell him he’s just being pessimistic, but you know, I’ve been to jail before because the police took advantage of me being such a trusting guy.
zh: 我總是告訴他他太悲觀了，但你知道，我就是太容易相信別人，所以我之前坐了牢，因為警察利用了我。

en: I’d hate you to come inside and see something out of context and suddenly think the worst.
zh: 我不願讓你們進來，因為你們看到什麼東西都會斷章取義，什麼事都往最壞的地方想，對此我很討厭。

en: Do you have a warrant?”
zh: 你們有搜查令嗎？」

en: “This isn’t a joking matter,” one of them says.
zh: 「這事不能開玩笑。」他們其中一個人說。

en: “I’m not joking.
zh: 「我不是開玩笑。

en: I’m telling you he isn’t here, and you’re standing on my property calling me a liar and asking if I mind having my rights violated.
zh: 我告訴你，他不在這裏，你們站在我家說我撒謊，你們侵犯了我的權利，還問我是否介意。

en: Now, I’ve told you what happened and I’ve been friendly about it, but now my patience is wearing thin.
zh: 現在，我已經告訴你們發生的一切了，我已經夠配合的了，但現在我快沒有耐心了。

en: So, unless you have a warrant, we’re done here.”
zh: 除非你們有搜查令，不然咱們的談話就此結束。」

en: “With your history, mate, you do know you’re playing with fire.
zh: 「夥計，以你的閱歷而言，你知道你在玩火吧？

en: Harboring a fugitive will see you back in jail.”
zh: 窩藏逃犯會判你入獄。」

en: “He’s not a fugitive, he’s a confused man who doesn’t know what he’s done or what he’s doing, and right now he probably doesn’t even know where he is.
zh: 「他不是逃犯，他只是神志不清，不知道他以前做了什麼或者他現在在做什麼，而他可能甚至還不知道自己現在在哪裡。

en: Come back when you get a warrant.”
zh: 等你們拿到搜查令再回來吧。」

en: “It won’t just be us coming back,” one of them says, and then Jerry hears the door close.
zh: 「到時回來的可能就不止我們兩個人了。」其中一人說，接著，傑瑞聽到關門聲。

en: There are retreating footsteps as the men head back to their car.
zh: 腳步聲響了起來，兩個男人走回自己的車。

en: He hears one of them say to the other, “I told you we should have just waited. This has gotten too personal for you.”
zh: 他聽到其中一人對另一人說道：「我告訴過你，我們應該守株待兔，你也太感情用事了。」

en: “The son of a bitch broke two of my fingers,” the other guy says.
zh: 「這個渾蛋弄斷了我的兩根手指。」另一個人說，「不過我是有點兒感情用事。」

en: Jerry can’t hear the rest as they move out of range.
zh: 他們走遠了，傑瑞聽不到他們後來都說了些什麼。

en: Hans comes into the garage. He puts his finger over his lips to tell Jerry not to say anything.
zh: 漢斯走進車庫，把手指放在嘴唇旁，示意傑瑞不要作聲。

en: Then he walks to the garage door and listens, but by now the two cops have gotten into their car. They start it, back out of the driveway, and park on the road.
zh: 他走到車庫門口，側耳傾聽，現在兩個警察已經上了車，他們驅車駛出車道，停在了路上。

en: He heads back into the house, beckoning Jerry to follow him.
zh: 他轉身走進屋裡，招呼傑瑞跟他走。

en: “If they’re parking outside, then they’re getting somebody else to take care of the warrant,” he says, keeping his voice low.
zh: 「如果他們把車停在外面，那可能會讓別人去取搜查令。」他壓低聲音說。

en: “I think people are already on their way,” Jerry says.
zh: 「我認為那些人已經在路上了。」傑瑞說，「其中一個人手上打著石膏，對吧？」

en: “That’s right.”
“I broke his fingers.
zh: 「我擰斷了他的手指。

en: I think they came here ahead of the others because they want the arrest.”
zh: 我覺得他們先於其他人來到這裏，是因為他們想要逮捕我。」

en: They walk into the dining room, and Hans unlocks the French doors that lead into the backyard.
zh: 他們走進餐廳，漢斯打開後院的法式門鎖。

en: “In that case they’ll be here any minute, and if it’s the Armed Offenders Unit, they’ll be storming the place.
zh: 「這個時候他們隨時都會趕到這裏，如果是武裝罪犯調查組的，他們將對這個地方強制進攻。

en: You need to run, and right now.”
zh: 你快跑，馬上。」

en: “You’re not coming with me?”
zh: 「你不跟我一起走嗎？」

en: “I have things I need to take care of here.”
zh: 「我還有事情要辦。」

en: He hands Jerry a cell phone. “Climb the back fence and make your way through the neighbors’ house to the street.
zh: 他遞給傑瑞一部手機，「爬上后圍牆，穿過鄰居家到街上去。

en: Turn left and when you get to the end of the block turn right.
zh: 向左轉，到達街區盡頭向右轉。

en: You got that?”
zh: 你聽明白了嗎？」

en: “I got it.”
zh: 「我知道了。」

en: “Say it back to me.”
zh: 「重複一遍給我聽。」

en: “Over the fence to the street.
zh: 「翻過圍牆到街上去。

en: Turn left, then right at the next intersection.”
zh: 向左轉，在下一個十字路口向右轉。」

en: “Keep walking in that direction and after two hundred yards there’s an alleyway. It leads through to a park.
zh: 「順著這個方向一直向前走，在二百米的地方有一條小巷，通向一個公園。

en: Head down there and stay hidden until I call you, okay?”
zh: 你到公園裡去，找個地方躲起來，直到我打電話給你，好嗎？」

en: “What are you—”
“Just do it.
zh: 「照我說的做就對了。

en: Come on, let’s go.
zh: 來，咱們走。

en: And if they find you, don’t you dare mention me, okay?”
zh: 如果他們發現你，可不要提我，好嗎？」

en: They move quickly across the backyard, where the lawn is ankle deep and the surrounding garden is overrun with stinging nettle and weeds big enough to have developed inch-thick trunks.
zh: 他們飛速穿過後院，那裡的草長到了腳踝，花園四周長滿蕁麻和雜草，每一株都長得像一英寸粗的樹榦。

en: Jerry climbs the fence and drops to the other side behind a house that has a small inflatable pool, and a sand pit with cat shit littering the top of it.
zh: 傑瑞爬上圍牆，跳到另一頭，那裡有一個小型充氣游泳池，還有一個沙坑，上面是七零八落的貓屎。

en: He thinks, he thinks, how did life get to this point?
zh: 他在想自己怎麼會淪落到這步田地了？

en: He makes his way around the side of the house and past a tricycle and a soccer ball to the street, breathing heavily already.
zh: 他繞過房子，把一輛三輪車和足球甩在身後，走上街道，累得呼哧呼哧地喘著粗氣。

en: He turns left and runs like Hans told him to.
zh: 他向左轉彎，像漢斯說的那樣跑了起來。

en: At the end of the block he turns right and keeps running and finds the alleyway.
zh: 在街區的盡頭，他向右拐，繼續向前跑，看到了一條小巷。

en: He’s halfway down it when he hears a car approaching.
zh: 他沿著巷子走到半道，聽見一輛汽車駛過來。

en: He turns around to see a patrol car passing by, but it doesn’t slow down and nobody in the car looks in his direction.
zh: 他轉身一看，發現一輛巡邏車正從身旁呼嘯而過，但它並沒有放慢車速，車上也沒有人注意到他。

en: He reaches the park.
zh: 他到達公園。

en: One of the greatest things about this city, he remembers, is the number of parks. It’s why it’s called The Garden City, and not because of the amount of people getting buried in vegetable patches.
zh: 他記得這個城市最了不起的壯舉就是有許多座公園，這就是它被稱為花園城市的原因。

en: This park has a few people in it, some kids playing on the swings, another one on a merry-go-round, some teenagers smoking by the toilets with their hoodies shading their faces.
zh: 公園裡人不多，幾個小孩在盪鞦韆，一個小孩在玩旋轉木馬，還有幾個十多歲的孩子躲在廁所旁吸煙，他們個個都用帽衫遮著臉。

en: There are a bunch of trees lining the north side creating shade.
zh: 靠北邊是一排排的參天大樹，太陽照在樹上落下樹蔭。

en: He could go hide in there, but if people see him walking in it’ll raise suspicion.
zh: 他可以躲在那裡，不過看見他走過來的人肯定會起疑心。

en: Then he sees it—a park bench right where lawn meets tree. He makes his way over and sits down.
zh: 後來他發現一個好去處，那就是樹林和草地交接處的公園長椅。

en: He gets the phone out and stares at the screen.
zh: 他疲憊不堪，拿出手機，盯著屏幕看。

en: He acts like he’s texting or checking the weather, the way people do when they’re alone in social situations and have a phone handy.
zh: 他做出一副發簡訊或查看天氣預報的姿態，當人們獨自一人出現在社交場合，身上帶著手機時常會這麼做。

en: His ankles are sore from the stinging nettle. He scratches at them and the relief is instant before getting worse.
zh: 蕁麻刺得他腳踝一陣一陣地痛，他伸手去撓，好在還不嚴重，可以在瞬間得到緩解。

en: The phone rings. “Hans?”
zh: 電話鈴響了：「是漢斯嗎？」

en: “You at the park?” Hans asks.
zh: 「你在公園嗎？」漢斯問。

en: “I’m here.”
zh: 「我在這裏。」

en: “Good. Stay calm. When the cops are done here, I’ll come and get you.
zh: 「好，保持冷靜，警察一撤走我就去接你。

en: I’ll have to drive around for a bit to make sure I’m not being tailed, but hopefully I’ll be there in an hour or two.
zh: 我得開車繞道，以確保我不被跟蹤，但我估計我會在一兩個小時後到那裡。

en: Do nothing. Just stay out of sight until I come for you, okay?
zh: 什麼也不要做，躲起來，不要讓別人看見，等著我去接你，好嗎？

en: Stay at the park, okay?”
zh: 待在公園，好嗎？」

en: “Okay,” Jerry says.
zh: 「好的。」傑瑞說。

en: “Okay?”
zh: 「好嗎？」

en: “I said okay. I’ll sit here and wait for you.”
zh: 「我說好的，我就坐在這裏等你。」

en: “Good.
zh: 「好的。

en: Don’t wander off, Jerry.
zh: 不要亂跑，傑瑞。

en: In fact, why don’t you spend your time thinking about where else you could have hidden that journal?
zh: 其實你為什麼不花點時間想想還有沒有可能把日記藏在別的什麼地方？

en: It’s important we find it.”
zh: 我們要找到它，這對我們很重要。」

en: They hang up.
zh: 他們掛斷電話。

en: Jerry stares at the phone and he sits in the shade as alone as ever, the police hunting him as his exhaustion grows deeper.
zh: 傑瑞盯著手機，他獨自一人坐在樹蔭下，警察在追捕他，他越發疲憊了。

en: He’s thinking about Eric the orderly, he’s getting a little sleepy, and he’s wondering if it’s possible Eric has done these bad things.
zh: 他想起了護理員艾瑞克。他有點兒困了，迷迷糊糊地想是否真有可能是艾瑞克幹了這些勾當。

en: He tries to think about where else he could have hidden the journal, and there’s something there, a memory like a splinter in his brain that he can’t quite get to, but instead of focusing on that, he thinks about Eric.
zh: 他在想還有可能把日記藏在別的什麼地方，他大腦中的記憶就像碎片一般難以拼湊，而且他也難以集中精力，因為總是想著艾瑞克。

en: He yawns again, then suddenly snaps awake, unaware he was starting to doze.
zh: 他又打了個哈欠，忽然間清醒了過來，彷彿沒有察覺到他開始打瞌睡了。

en: All he has to do is stay awake and wait for Hans.
zh: 他要做的就是保持清醒，等待漢斯。

en: Then they’ll find Eric. He wonders what exactly it is they’re going to do to make Eric confess.
zh: 接著他們會去找艾瑞克，他不知道應該用什麼辦法才能讓艾瑞克坦承他所犯下的罪行。

en: He starts to doze again, telling himself to hold on, hold on.
zh: 他又開始打瞌睡了，他告訴自己，一定要挺住，挺住。
